item.title: Report X-2023081128
item.description:
Report X-2023081128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA identified leaking hazmat package in unload. Upon inspection it was discovered the cap on one of the gallon containers was loose, causing the internal leakage. Package was wet when unloaded from trl# 832534 OLIV on door 116 in unload from 3:02-5:04pm. DescribePack: One of the caps on one of the gallon containers was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA identified the leaking hazmat package and immediately responded with appropriate materials and procedures to mitigate release.

item.title: Report E-2023090187
item.description:
Report E-2023090187

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 30, 2023, two (2) one-gallon pails of concrete stain acid (UN1263) were punctured with a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor and adjacent boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the impacted pallet, removed the damaged containers, removed the impacted boxes, and restacked the unaffected cargo. The damaged pails were collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. HES personnel utilized absorbents, absorbent pads, and neutralizer to remediate the impacted areas. The impacted solids were collected with hand tools. All impacted boxes, absorbents, and absorbent pads were collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums. All three (3) drums were labeled and staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one poly 5 gallon pail of floor stripper (un1824) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 cups of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090060
item.description:
Report E-2023090060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 31, 2023, at 1252 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Memphis, Tennessee regarding the release of approximately (1) quart of Inhibited Methacrylic Acid-GMAA (UN2531, Methacrylic Acid, Stabilized, 8, II). Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the trailer floor. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080934
item.description:
Report X-2023080934

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: JAMB ON IC BELT CAUSED BACKING AND PACKAGES BEING KNOCKED/DROPPED OF BELT. PACKAG WAS UPRIGHTED, PLACED IN TOTE AND SPILLED ACID WAS FUTHER CLEANED UP. DescribePack: CAP BECAME MISALIGNED FROM WEIGHT OF PACKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE MOVED TO HAZMAT CAGE - OUTER PACKING SEPERATED FROM INNER PACKING AS OUTER PACKING WAS STILL SMOKING AND REACTIVE TO ACID RELEASE. ALL PLACED IN TOTE LINED WITH NEAUTRIZING POWEDER AND PLACED UNDER HOOD.

item.title: Report E-2023090079
item.description:
Report E-2023090079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of NA1760 was crushed during a load shift and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew overpacked the one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. All NA1760-impacted material was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090004
item.description:
Report E-2023090004

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NKX experienced a UN3105 Norox MCP-75 Red release from a 5-gallon jerrican. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting an 8’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot below due to the pail being crushed as a result of stacking. Oil dri was deployed onto the impacted areas and worked into to clean and remove all free-standing liquid. The damaged empty jug, absorbents, PPE, and spill pads were then collected into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. An impacted pallet was also cut up and placed into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. Both drums were submerged with water per XPO’s waste vendor requirements. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2023080881

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package reported leaking on load side. Upon inspection it was discovered the glass container of potassium hydroxide solution was shattered, causing the internal leakage. Further investigation revealed the package was sent on the overhead sorter. Package contained 2 different class 3 flammable liquid materials. DescribePack: The glass container of potassium hydroxide was shattered. Glass container of Toluene was undamaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA immediately responded to call for damaged hazmat, using appropriate materials and procedures to mitigate release.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was quickly removed from sort, placed in a lined tote. The leakage was confined to the carton.

item.title: Report X-2023080414
item.description:
Report X-2023080414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/21/2023 at approximately 2115, Dangerous Goods Administration recieved a call from Employee 245975 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting an alcohol spill. The shipment was 54 fiberboard boxes overpacked on a pallet. One of the boxes showed signs of liquid damage. Further inspection reavealed that the bottle inside of the box had completely leaked, cause umknown the damaged package was removed from the overpack and set for disposal and the remaining pieces of the shipment await an amended shipper's declaration for further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023080394
item.description:
Report X-2023080394

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/14/2023 at approxiamtely 1215, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting an declared toxic shipment. The shipment conststed of 5 overpackaed pallets, covered in white shrinkwrap. The shrinkwrap on one of the pallets torn for an unknown reason, revealing a package that was marked "UN 3249" and labeled with a 6.1 hazard label. This overpacked pallet contained hidden dangerous goods. Dangerous Goods Administration instructed the location to hold the shipment for further investigation; however, miscommunications lead to the shipment proceeding in transmit internationally, along with the other 4 overpacked pallets. Dangerous Goods Adminstrition has instructed the team to hold the shipment for furhter investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023080365
item.description:
Report X-2023080365

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Part of a multi piece shipment, package was offered to a spill cleanup specialist at the Memphis Hub when staining indicated package was leaking. Package was seen to be in a fibreboard box. It was reported inside the fibreboard box there were 2 plastic jugs each containing 1 L of UN1245, Methyl Isobutyl Ketone. During further investigation found a cap on one of the jugs was not tightly secured on the bottle and allowed for an estimated .125L to escape. Styrofoam peanuts were used for dunnage. There was no positive closure noted on the jugs. Contents of the package were placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper contacted for amened shipper's declaration for continued travel.

item.title: Report X-2023080406
item.description:
Report X-2023080406

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-30
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 30 a package containing UN1950, AEROSOLS FLAMMABLE, 2.1, started leaking black paint. It was discovered that 2 of the cans inside of the package were activated and released their contents. The spill was cleaned and shipment held. The shipper has been contacted to determine disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023080403
item.description:
Report X-2023080403

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-30
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704649 PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704660 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704671 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704693 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )On July 30th 6 jerricans containing UN1170, ETHANOL SOLUTION, 3, III were found to be compromised. Two of the jerricans leaked some of the liquid contained inside, and the other four only had an odor. We are unable to determine the source of the leak on the two jerricans. All were placed into salvage drums and are awaiting disposition and amended shippers declarations if necessary, from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023080319
item.description:
Report X-2023080319

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called for a fiberboard box with signs of a release. While investigating the the fiberboard box the spill agent found a styrofoam inner packaging which contained a plastic bag that held plastic jerrycans. One of the jerrycans had a loose cap. All the contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080007
item.description:
Report X-2023080007

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the dangerous goods building for a leaking package. The agent was given a fiberboard box containing a class 9. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans seperated by a fiberboard divider. One of the cans was dented causing the lid to open and release all of its contents inside of the box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023071242
item.description:
Report X-2023071242

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 26th, a package was on a sort belt when it was moved and it dropped, two bottles were broken as a result of the drop. The package contained four bottles of UN1593, DICHLOROMETHANE, 6.1, III. The package was placed into a salvage drum. An amended shippers declaration was requested of the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023071232
item.description:
Report X-2023071232

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 11 this package was discovered leaking prior to the sort process. The package contained UN1591, 0-DICHLOROBENZENE, 6.1, III. One of the inner receptacles broke during transit and leaked the contents. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and the shipper was contacted to provide an amended shippers declaration.

item.title: Report X-2023070539
item.description:
Report X-2023070539

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A spill agent was called to the Memphis dangerous goods building for a fiberboard box with signs of release. The agent was told that the fiberboard box had been dropped during the loading process. While investigating the package there were two metal buckets inside both had positive closure rings. One of the buckets was damaged on the bottom chime and this was the source of the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. One fiberboard box containing 2 metal cans with plastic rings around the tops (cans were inside of a plastic bag). One can leaked. Remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023080901
item.description:
Report X-2023080901

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A bag containing aerosol cans was damaged coming down the flex slide. Upon inspection, it was discovered that two of the cans had discharged. The bag was quickly taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: The cap was broken completely off of one can. The other had been compressed enough to discharge some contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was quickly taken to the HMPA, where it was placed in a lined tote. Spillage was confined to the inside of the padded mailer.
